metadata.title: CVE-2020-10029 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c.

criterions.comment: glibc package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.31-0ubuntu9').
